description: The first stretch from Springwood and Winmalee is mostly along suburban footpaths, consider taking the bus instead.
After stocking up on supplies the trailhead is a short distance down the street from the shopping centre.
The Blue Gum Swamp is somewhat of a local secret unspoiled by tourist busses.
There is a choice between two paths, one through the gully and one across the ridge, both are worthwhile choices, each has unique scenery.
Where the two trails meet back up, a long harsh climb makes you earn the breathtaking unfenced lookout at the end.
After an adventurous crossover to the second peak a very long and smooth descent overlooking the Grose River leads down into the rural countryside of Yarramundi.
There is a short stretch of roadside walking to the riverside beach of Yarramundi Reserve, which is well worth strolling around for a while.
From there very carefully follow the shoulder and bikepaths along the highway to Richmond.
While not especially dangerous, the roadside sections require care and attention.

markers.description: Get the train to Springwood using transportnsw.info.
To cut some urban walking time off the start, take the bus from Springwood Station to the Winmalee Shops using transportnsw.info.
The left fork leads down through the Blue Gum Swamp, the right across Beehive Ridge. Both are equally valid.
Exit the station to the left and follow the road down the shopping street.
- 1.5h / 6km Take the bus to Winmalee Shopping Centre to skip the first stretch.
Continue past the bowling club and turn left at the roundabout towards Winmalee.
Cross the bridge across the railway line.
From the roundabout follow the signs to Winmalee.
Follow Hawkesbury Road all the way to the Winmalee Shopping Centre on the left.
Continue past the shopping center until the road ends at the carpark for the park entrance.
Follow the firetrail the continues past the gate.
A sign at the split in the trail offers either the Blue Gum Swamp or Shaws Ridge. Both take about as long.
Either trail ends at a sign pointing to Grose Head South, wich should be followed.
The trail zig zags up hill and ends at another sign. Follow it to Grose Head South
The firetrail ends at the lookout. Please be very careful near the edge.
From the end of the firetrail a narrow path starts following the cliff line.
The rough trail continues along several lookout spots.
Eventually the trail turns into a very rough climb up to the other side of Grose Head.
Find the overgrown trig at the top.

markers.title: Shhh, it's a Secret
explanation: Leave a friendly note in the geocache logbook. That it can lie here undisturbed means you're in a special place.
markers.description: <center>Visit this location to earn the mystery trophy</center>
Near the trig a firetrail starts down the ridge.
Watch for several lookouts along the way.
Follow the firetrail all the way down until it finally joins Mountain Ave.
Continue along Mountain Ave to the intersection with Springwood Road and follow it to the left.
Watch on the left for Tree Adventures carpark, where refreshments can be bought.
A little further up the road enter Yaramundi Reserve for a short detour or a rest along the river.
From Yeramundi Reserve follow Springwood Road to the left across the bridge and beyond.
Springwood Road ends at an intersection. Follow the signs left to Richmond.
Follow the directions all the way to the centre of Richmond.
Cross the road at the intersection with March Street and follow Bosworth Street past the KFC.
At the roundabout turn right and follow Windsor Street past the shops.
Follow the path past the sportsfield on the right.
The train station is across the street from the park.
Plan your return trip from Richmond at transportnsw.info.
